meanings.definition: A small egg of an insect, especially a louse or other parasitic insect.
meanings.sent1: The nids were carefully collected by the scientist for study.
meanings.sent2: The nids were hidden under the leaves, waiting to hatch.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the nids for tiny acorns and tried to bury them.
meanings.sent4: The nids resembled tiny pearls, each holding the promise of new life.
meanings.sent5: The children marveled at the delicate beauty of the nids, imagining the tiny creatures inside.

meanings.definition: A nest or breeding place of certain insects or animals.
meanings.sent1: The bird built its nids high up in the tree to keep the eggs safe.
meanings.sent2: The nids of the ants were a complex network of tunnels underground.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon found a cozy spot in the attic to make its nids, much to the homeowner's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a bustling city of nids, each family with its own little home.
meanings.sent5: The nids of the bees hummed with activity as they worked together to build their honeycombs.
